subject: Ethics
title: The Location Tracking Economy
description: A quick, practical guide to The Location Tracking Economy.

hook.text: Your phone pings cell towers about 500 times a day. Each ping reveals where you are within a few meters.

buildup.text: Weather apps, games, and flashlight apps all request location access. Most don't need it â€” they sell it.

discovery.text: Location data firms compile movement patterns for 200 million US devices and sell access for pennies per person.

twist.text: A newsletter used Grindr location data to out a Catholic priest. 'Anonymous' data isn't anonymous at all.

climax.text: Your location history reveals your doctor, church, therapist, and habits â€” all without a warrant.

punchline.text: Where you go tells more about you than what you say.

quiz.question: Why is 'anonymous' location data often not truly anonymous?
options: Movement patterns can identify specific individuals
Location data is always paired with real names
